question.body: Which of the following best demonstrates the concept that “structure determines function” for cells?

multiple_choice.choice: a long, branched cell functioning to travel through the body and transport substances
a circular, compressible, small cell functioning for muscle contraction
a long, branched cell functioning to communicate with other cells in the body
a cell packed with protein fibers and interconnected to other cells to store fat

response.feedback: Incorrect. If a cell was long and branched it would have difficulty moving in blood vessels to travel throughout the body.
Incorrect. A circular, compressible cell would not have good leverage or strength to move proteins.
Correct. A long, branched cell structure would allow this cell to connect to many other cells at once for communication
Incorrect. A cell that is already packed with protein would not be good for storing fat.
